result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A. Vahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Scott A. Vahl
parties.address: 2910 W Grand Ave., Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders the court costs to be paid at the rate of $25/mo beginning 7-15-15.

Jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Defendant Scott A. Vahl in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty placed agreement on the record.  DE enters plea of no contest. DE enters plea of not contest to citation 15TR101. Court found DE guilty and ordered a forfeiture of $200.50.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Factual basis exists.  Court finds DE guilty.  Court orders 20 days county jail with huber and good time to begin no later then August 26, 2015 by 4:30 p.m.; court costs; DNA surcharge.  Court orders payment plan of $25/mo beginning 7-15-15. ba
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Scott A. Vahl in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty.  Court orders $250.00 signature bond; booking and no possession or consumption of controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 10:15 am.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
